meanings.definition: To be the reason for something happening.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise caused the dog to bark.
meanings.sent2: The rain caused the flowers to grow.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected visitor caused quite a stir in the house.
meanings.sent4: His absence caused a void in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The faulty wiring caused a dangerous situation in the building.

meanings.sent1: Her hard work caused her to succeed in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The chef's special recipe caused a sensation among the diners.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick caused laughter and amazement in the audience.
meanings.sent4: His words caused a change of heart in his friend.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock caused him to wake up early for the meeting.

meanings.definition: To bring about an effect or result.
meanings.sent1: The new policy caused confusion among the employees.
meanings.sent2: The medicine caused the symptoms to disappear.
meanings.sent3: The prank caused laughter and embarrassment at the same time.
meanings.sent4: His actions caused a chain reaction of events.
meanings.sent5: The storm caused damage to the fragile roof of the house.
